    application_key=os.environ['OVH_APPLICATION_KEY'],
    application_secret=os.environ['OVH_APPLICATION_SECRET'],
    consumer_key=os.environ['OVH_CONSUMER_KEY']
)

# Configure load balancer
service_name = os.environ['OVH_SERVICE_NAME']
lb_id = os.environ.get('OVH_LOAD_BALANCER_ID')

if lb_id:
    # Add backend servers
    backend_config = {
        'displayName': 'manifolded-production',
        'port': 8080,
        'probe': {
            'url': '/health',
            'interval': 30,
            'method': 'GET'
        }
    }
    
    result = client.post(f'/ipLoadbalancing/{lb_id}/tcp/backend', **backend_config)
    print(f"Load balancer configured: {result}")
EOF
    
    # Setup SSL certificate
    if [ -n "${DOMAIN_NAME}" ]; then
        log_info "Setting up SSL for ${DOMAIN_NAME}..."
        # This would typically use Let's Encrypt or OVH SSL
    fi
    
    log_info "Load balancer setup completed"
}

# Run smoke tests
run_smoke_tests() {
    log_info "Running smoke tests..."
    
    # Test core API
    if curl -f -s "http://${NOMAD_ADDR}/v1/agent/health" > /dev/null; then
        log_info "âœ“ Nomad API is healthy"
    else
        log_error "âœ— Nomad API is not responding"
    fi
    
    # Test Manifolded core
    local core_endpoint=$(consul catalog services | jq -r '.["manifolded-core"][0].ServiceAddress')
    if [ -n "$core_endpoint" ]; then
        if curl -f -s "http://${core_endpoint}:8080/health" > /dev/null; then
            log_info "âœ“ Manifolded Core is healthy"
        else
            log_error "âœ— Manifolded Core is not responding"
        fi
    fi
    
    # Test Phoenix/HPQC endpoint
    local phoenix_endpoint=$(consul catalog services | jq -r '.["manifolded-phoenix"][0].ServiceAddress')
    if [ -n "$phoenix_endpoint" ]; then
        if curl -f -s "http://${phoenix_endpoint}:4000/health" > /dev/null; then
            log_info "âœ“ Phoenix/HPQC is healthy"
        else
            log_warn "âœ— Phoenix/HPQC is not responding"
        fi
    fi
    
    log_info "Smoke tests completed"
}

# Print deployment summary
print_summary() {
    echo
    echo "============================================================"
    echo "           Manifolded Deployment Summary"
    echo "============================================================"
    echo "Environment:        ${DEPLOYMENT_ENV}"
    echo "Region:            ${OVH_REGION}"
    echo "Datacenter:        ${OVH_DATACENTER}"
    echo
    echo "Services:"
    echo "  Nomad:           ${NOMAD_ADDR}"
    echo "  Consul:          ${CONSUL_ADDR}"
    echo "  Vault:           ${VAULT_ADDR}"
    echo
    echo "Container Images:"
    echo "  Core:            ${CORE_IMAGE}"
    echo "  CLI:             ${CLI_IMAGE}"
    echo "  WASM:            ${WASM_IMAGE}"
    echo
    echo "Endpoints:"
    
    # Get service endpoints from Consul
    if command -v consul &> /dev/null; then
        local core_addr=$(consul catalog services | jq -r '.["manifolded-core"][0].ServiceAddress' 2>/dev/null || echo "N/A")
        local phoenix_addr=$(consul catalog services | jq -r '.["manifolded-phoenix"][0].ServiceAddress' 2>/dev/null || echo "N/A")
        echo "  Core API:        ${core_addr}:8080"
        echo "  Phoenix/HPQC:    ${phoenix_addr}:4000"
        echo "  gRPC:            ${core_addr}:50051"
    fi
    
    echo
    echo "Next Steps:"
    echo "  1. Verify deployment: nomad job status manifolded"
    echo "  2. Check logs: nomad alloc logs <alloc-id>"
    echo "  3. Access UI: http://<load-balancer-ip>"
    echo "  4. Test CLI: manifolded --endpoint grpc://<core-ip>:50051 status"
    echo "============================================================"
}

# Main deployment flow
main() {
    log_info "Starting Manifolded deployment to OVH Cloud..."
    
    # Parse arguments
    ACTION="${1:-deploy}"
    
    case "$ACTION" in
        deploy)
            check_prerequisites
            deploy_infrastructure
            setup_vault
            setup_consul
            deploy_nomad
            setup_monitoring
            setup_load_balancer
            run_smoke_tests
            print_summary
            ;;
        update)
            check_prerequisites
            deploy_nomad
            run_smoke_tests
            ;;
        rollback)
            log_info "Rolling back deployment..."
            nomad job revert manifolded 1
            ;;
        status)
            nomad job status manifolded
            consul catalog services
            ;;
        destroy)
            log_warn "Destroying deployment..."
            read -p "Are you sure? (yes/no): " confirm
            if [ "$confirm" = "yes" ]; then
                nomad job stop -purge manifolded
                python3 "${PROJECT_ROOT}/scripts/ovh_deploy.py" --action destroy
            fi
            ;;
        *)
            echo "Usage: $0 [deploy|update|rollback|status|destroy]"
            exit 1
            ;;
    esac
    
    log_info "Deployment operation completed successfully!"
}

# Run main function
main "$@"

input.content:
# Manifolded Production Configuration
# This file contains production settings for the complete platform

manifolded:
  environment: production
  version: 1.0.0
  
  # Core Settings
  core:
    host: 0.0.0.0
    port: 8080
    grpc_port: 50051
    metrics_port: 9090
    max_connections: 10000
    request_timeout: 30s
    shutdown_timeout: 30s
    
  # Security Configuration
  security:
    # 8-Layer Sandboxing Configuration
    sandboxing:
      enabled: true
      layers:
        - name: "namespace_isolation"
          type: "linux_namespaces"
          config:
            user: true
            pid: true
            network: true
            mount: true
            ipc: true
            uts: true
            cgroup: true
        - name: "seccomp_filtering"
          type: "seccomp"
          profile: "strict"
        - name: "capability_dropping"
          type: "capabilities"
          drop_all: true
          allow: ["CAP_NET_BIND_SERVICE"]
        - name: "apparmor_profiles"
          type: "apparmor"
          profile: "manifolded-strict"
        - name: "cgroup_limits"
          type: "cgroups"
          memory_limit: "2Gi"
          cpu_quota: "200%"
        - name: "network_policies"
          type: "network"
          default_deny: true
        - name: "filesystem_isolation"
          type: "filesystem"
          readonly_root: true
          tmpfs_size: "100Mi"
        - name: "kata_containers"
          type: "kata"
          enabled: true
          runtime: "kata-runtime"
    
    # Authentication & Authorization
    auth:
      jwt_secret: "${VAULT:secret/manifolded/jwt_secret}"
      token_expiry: 24h
      refresh_token_expiry: 7d
      mfa_required: true
      
    # Encryption
    encryption:
      data_at_rest: true
      algorithm: "AES-256-GCM"
      key_rotation_days: 90
      tls_min_version: "1.3"
      
    # Audit Logging
    audit:
      enabled: true
      retention_days: 2555  # 7 years for compliance
      sensitive_data_masking: true
      
  # Database Configuration
  database:
    primary:
      host: "${VAULT:secret/manifolded/db_host}"
      port: 5432
      name: manifolded_production
      username: "${VAULT:secret/manifolded/db_user}"
      password: "${VAULT:secret/manifolded/db_password}"
      ssl_mode: require
      max_connections: 100
      connection_timeout: 10s
    
    replica:
      enabled: true
      hosts:
        - "${VAULT:secret/manifolded/db_replica_1}"
        - "${VAULT:secret/manifolded/db_replica_2}"
      load_balancing: round_robin
  
  # WASM Configuration (Vimmacs Integration)
  wasm:
    runtime: wasmer
    compiler: cranelift
    cache_enabled: true
    cache_size: "10Gi"
    max_memory_per_instance: "4Gi"
    max_instances: 100
    precompilation: true
    
    # WebAssembly System Interface
    wasi:
      enabled: true
      filesystem_access: sandboxed
      network_access: restricted
      
    # Arch Linux WASM Distribution
    arch_linux:
      enabled: true
      base_image: "registry.ovh.net/manifolded/wasm:latest"
      packages:
        - base
        - base-devel
        - git
        - neovim
        - emacs
  
  # Phoenix/Elixir Configuration (HPQC)
  phoenix:
    enabled: true
    port: 4000
    secret_key_base: "${VAULT:secret/manifolded/phoenix_secret}"
    
    # High-Performance Quantum Computing
    hpqc:
      enabled: true
      nif_pool_size: 256
      quantum_threads: 16
      coherence_time_ms: 1000
      error_correction: true
      
    # LiveView Configuration
    live_view:
      enabled: true
      signing_salt: "${VAULT:secret/manifolded/liveview_salt}"
  
  # Container Orchestration
  orchestration:
    platform: nomad
    
    nomad:
      address: "${NOMAD_ADDR}"
      token: "${VAULT:secret/manifolded/nomad_token}"
      datacenter: "ovh-bhs1"
      namespace: "production"
      
    # Resource Limits
    resources:
      cpu: 4000  # MHz
      memory: 8192  # MB
      disk: 50000  # MB
      network: 1000  # Mbps
      
    # Auto-scaling
    autoscaling:
      enabled: true
      min_instances: 3
      max_instances: 50
      target_cpu_percent: 70
      target_memory_percent: 80
      scale_up_cooldown: 60s
      scale_down_cooldown: 300s
  
  # OVH Cloud Configuration
  ovh:
    region: "BHS"
    datacenter: "bhs1"
    
    # Object Storage
    object_storage:
      endpoint: "https://storage.bhs.cloud.ovh.net"
      bucket: "${VAULT:secret/manifolded/s3_bucket}"
      access_key: "${VAULT:secret/manifolded/s3_access_key}"
      secret_key: "${VAULT:secret/manifolded/s3_secret_key}"
      
    # Container Registry
    registry:
      endpoint: "registry.ovh.net"
      namespace: "manifolded"
      username: "${VAULT:secret/manifolded/registry_user}"
      password: "${VAULT:secret/manifolded/registry_password}"
      
    # Load Balancer
    load_balancer:
      id: "${OVH_LOAD_BALANCER_ID}"
      algorithm: "round_robin"
      sticky_sessions: true
      health_check_interval: 10s
  
  # Service Mesh (Consul Connect)
  service_mesh:
    enabled: true
    
    consul:
      address: "${CONSUL_ADDR}"
      token: "${VAULT:secret/manifolded/consul_token}"
      datacenter: "ovh-bhs1"
      
    # Service Discovery
    services:
      - name: "manifolded-core"
        port: 8080
        tags: ["api", "grpc", "production"]
        health_check:
          http: "/health"
          interval: "10s"
          timeout: "5s"
      - name: "manifolded-phoenix"
        port: 4000
        tags: ["web", "hpqc", "production"]
        health_check:
          http: "/health"
          interval: "10s"
      - name: "manifolded-wasm"
        port: 8081
        tags: ["wasm", "runtime", "production"]
        health_check:
          grpc: "localhost:50052"
          interval: "10s"
  
  # Monitoring & Observability
  monitoring:
    prometheus:
      enabled: true
      endpoint: "http://prometheus:9090"
      scrape_interval: 15s
      retention: 30d
      
    grafana:
      enabled: true
      endpoint: "http://grafana:3000"
      
    loki:
      enabled: true
      endpoint: "http://loki:3100"
      
    jaeger:
      enabled: true
      endpoint: "http://jaeger:14268"
      sampling_rate: 0.001  # 0.1% in production
      
    alerts:
      enabled: true
      channels:
        - type: "email"
          addresses: ["ops@manifolded.ai"]
        - type: "slack"
          webhook: "${VAULT:secret/manifolded/slack_webhook}"
        - type: "pagerduty"
          key: "${VAULT:secret/manifolded/pagerduty_key}"
  
  # AI/LLM Configuration
  ai:
    providers:
      - name: "openai"
        enabled: true
        api_key: "${VAULT:secret/manifolded/openai_api_key}"
        model: "gpt-4-turbo"
        max_tokens: 8192
        temperature: 0.7
      - name: "anthropic"
        enabled: true
        api_key: "${VAULT:secret/manifolded/anthropic_api_key}"
        model: "claude-3-opus"
        max_tokens: 100000
      - name: "local"
        enabled: true
        endpoint: "http://ollama:11434"
        models: ["llama2", "codellama", "mistral"]
    
    # Rate Limiting
    rate_limiting:
      enabled: true
      requests_per_minute: 60
      requests_per_day: 10000
      burst_size: 100
  
  # Backup & Disaster Recovery
  backup:
    enabled: true
    schedule: "0 2 * * *"  # Daily at 2 AM
    retention_days: 30
    
    destinations:
      - type: "s3"
        bucket: "${VAULT:secret/manifolded/backup_bucket}"
        region: "BHS"
      - type: "ovh_archive"
        container: "manifolded-backups"
        
    # Point-in-time Recovery
    pitr:
      enabled: true
      wal_archive: true
      retention_hours: 168  # 7 days
  
  # Compliance & Regulatory
  compliance:
    frameworks:
      - "SOC2"
      - "ISO27001"
      - "GDPR"
      - "HIPAA"
      - "PCI-DSS"
      
    data_residency:
      enforce: true
      allowed_regions: ["EU", "US", "CA"]
      
    data_retention:
      user_data: 2555  # days (7 years)
      audit_logs: 2555
      metrics: 365
      
  # Feature Flags
  features:
    quantum_computing: true
    multi_tenant: true
    enterprise_sso: true
    advanced_analytics: true
    custom_branding: true
    api_gateway: true
    edge_deployment: false  # Coming soon
    
# Logging Configuration
logging:
  level: INFO
  format: json
  outputs:
    - type: stdout
      level: INFO
    - type: file
      path: /var/log/manifolded/app.log
      rotation: daily
      retention: 30
    - type: loki
      endpoint: "${LOKI_ENDPOINT}"
      labels:
        environment: production
        service: manifolded
        
# Performance Tuning
performance:
  worker_threads: 16
  connection_pool_size: 100
  cache_size: "10Gi"
  
  # JIT Compilation
  jit:
    enabled: true
    optimization_level: 3
    
  # Memory Management
  memory:
    heap_size: "4Gi"
    gc_threshold: 0.8
    
  # Network Optimization
  network:
    tcp_nodelay: true
    keep_alive: true
    keep_alive_interval: 30s

    tcp_nodelay: true
    keep_alive: true
    keep_alive_interval: 30s

input.content:
name: Production Deployment Pipeline

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main
      - production
    tags:
      - 'v*'
  pull_request:
    branches:
      - main
      - production
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      environment:
        description: 'Deployment environment'
        required: true
        default: 'production'
        type: choice
        options:
          - production
          - staging
          - development

env:
  OVH_REGISTRY: registry.ovh.net
  REGISTRY_NAMESPACE: manifolded
  CARGO_TERM_COLOR: always
  RUST_BACKTRACE: 1

jobs:
  # Security scanning job
  security-scan:
    name: Security Scan
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          submodules: recursive

      - name: Run Trivy security scan
        uses: aquasecurity/trivy-action@master
        with:
          scan-type: 'fs'
          scan-ref: '.'
          format: 'sarif'
          output: 'trivy-results.sarif'
          severity: 'CRITICAL,HIGH'

      - name: Upload Trivy results to GitHub Security
        uses: github/codeql-action/upload-sarif@v3
        with:
          sarif_file: 'trivy-results.sarif'

      - name: Check for secrets with TruffleHog
        uses: trufflesecurity/trufflehog@main
        with:
          path: ./
          base: main
          head: HEAD

  # Rust testing and linting
  rust-test:
    name: Rust Tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    strategy:
      matrix:
        rust: [stable, beta]
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup Rust toolchain
        uses: actions-rust-lang/setup-rust-toolchain@v1
        with:
          toolchain: ${{ matrix.rust }}
          components: rustfmt, clippy

      - name: Cache Rust dependencies
        uses: Swatinem/rust-cache@v2
        with:
          key: ${{ runner.os }}-rust-${{ matrix.rust }}

      - name: Run fmt check
        run: cargo fmt --all -- --check

      - name: Run clippy
        run: cargo clippy --all-features -- -D warnings

      - name: Run tests
        run: cargo test --all-features --workspace

      - name: Run security audit
        run: |
          cargo install cargo-audit
          cargo audit

  # Build container images
  build-images:
    name: Build Container Images
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [security-scan, rust-test]
    permissions:
      contents: read
      packages: write
      id-token: write
    outputs:
      version: ${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - name: Checkout Vimmacs repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          repository: ${{ github.repository_owner }}/vimmacs
          path: vimmacs
          token: ${{ secrets.VIMMACS_REPO_TOKEN }}

      - name: Generate version
        id: version
        run: |
          if [[ "${{ github.ref }}" == refs/tags/* ]]; then
            VERSION=${GITHUB_REF#refs/tags/}
          else
            VERSION=$(git describe --tags --always --dirty)-${{ github.sha }}
          fi
          echo "version=${VERSION}" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          echo "Version: ${VERSION}"

      - name: Set up Docker Buildx
        uses: docker/setup-buildx-action@v3

      - name: Log in to OVH Registry
        uses: docker/login-action@v3
        with:
          registry: ${{ env.OVH_REGISTRY }}
          username: ${{ secrets.OVH_REGISTRY_USERNAME }}
          password: ${{ secrets.OVH_REGISTRY_PASSWORD }}

      - name: Build and push Core image
        uses: docker/build-push-action@v5
        with:
          context: .
          file: docker/Dockerfile.production
          platforms: linux/amd64
          push: true
          tags: |
            ${{ env.OVH_REGISTRY }}/${{ env.REGISTRY_NAMESPACE }}/core:${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}
            ${{ env.OVH_REGISTRY }}/${{ env.REGISTRY_NAMESPACE }}/core:latest
          cache-from: type=registry,ref=${{ env.OVH_REGISTRY }}/${{ env.REGISTRY_NAMESPACE }}/core:buildcache
          cache-to: type=registry,ref=${{ env.OVH_REGISTRY }}/${{ env.REGISTRY_NAMESPACE }}/core:buildcache,mode=max
          build-args: |
            VERSION=${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}
            BUILD_DATE=${{ steps.date.outputs.date }}
            GIT_COMMIT=${{ github.sha }}

      - name: Build and push CLI image
        uses: docker/build-push-action@v5
        with:
          context: .
          file: docker/Dockerfile.cli
          platforms: linux/amd64,linux/arm64
          push: true
          tags: |
            ${{ env.OVH_REGISTRY }}/${{ env.REGISTRY_NAMESPACE }}/cli:${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}
            ${{ env.OVH_REGISTRY }}/${{ env.REGISTRY_NAMESPACE }}/cli:latest
          cache-from: type=registry,ref=${{ env.OVH_REGISTRY }}/${{ env.REGISTRY_NAMESPACE }}/cli:buildcache
          cache-to: type=registry,ref=${{ env.OVH_REGISTRY }}/${{ env.REGISTRY_NAMESPACE }}/cli:buildcache,mode=max

      - name: Build and push WASM image
        if: hashFiles('vimmacs/Dockerfile.arch-enterprise') != ''
        uses: docker/build-push-action@v5
        with:
          context: vimmacs
          file: vimmacs/Dockerfile.arch-enterprise
          platforms: linux/amd64
          push: true
          tags: |
            ${{ env.OVH_REGISTRY }}/${{ env.REGISTRY_NAMESPACE }}/wasm:${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}
            ${{ env.OVH_REGISTRY }}/${{ env.REGISTRY_NAMESPACE }}/wasm:latest

      - name: Generate SBOM
        uses: anchore/syft-action@v0
        with:
          image-ref: ${{ env.OVH_REGISTRY }}/${{ env.REGISTRY_NAMESPACE }}/core:${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}
          output-file: sbom.spdx.json
          format: spdx-json

      - name: Sign container images
        env:
          COSIGN_EXPERIMENTAL: 1
        run: |
          cosign sign --yes \
            ${{ env.OVH_REGISTRY }}/${{ env.REGISTRY_NAMESPACE }}/core:${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}
          cosign sign --yes \
            ${{ env.OVH_REGISTRY }}/${{ env.REGISTRY_NAMESPACE }}/cli:${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}

      - name: Upload SBOM
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: sbom
          path: sbom.spdx.json

  # Integration tests
  integration-test:
    name: Integration Tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: build-images
    services:
      postgres:
        image: postgres:15
        env:
          POSTGRES_PASSWORD: postgres
          POSTGRES_DB: manifolded_test
        options: >-
          --health-cmd pg_isready
          --health-interval 10s
          --health-timeout 5s
          --health-retries 5
        ports:
          - 5432:5432
      
      redis:
        image: redis:7-alpine
        options: >-
          --health-cmd "redis-cli ping"
          --health-interval 10s
          --health-timeout 5s
          --health-retries 5
        ports:
          - 6379:6379

    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Pull test images
        run: |
          docker pull ${{ env.OVH_REGISTRY }}/${{ env.REGISTRY_NAMESPACE }}/core:${{ needs.build-images.outputs.version }}
          docker pull ${{ env.OVH_REGISTRY }}/${{ env.REGISTRY_NAMESPACE }}/cli:${{ needs.build-images.outputs.version }}

      - name: Run integration tests
        run: |
          docker run --rm \
            --network host \
            -e DATABASE_URL=postgres://postgres:postgres@localhost:5432/manifolded_test \
            -e REDIS_URL=redis://localhost:6379 \
            ${{ env.OVH_REGISTRY }}/${{ env.REGISTRY_NAMESPACE }}/core:${{ needs.build-images.outputs.version }} \
            /opt/manifolded/bin/manifolded-test --integration

      - name: Run E2E tests
        run: |
          ./scripts/test-production.sh e2e

  # Deploy to OVH Cloud
  deploy:
    name: Deploy to Production
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [build-images, integration-test]
    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' || startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/tags/v')
    environment:
      name: production
      url: https://manifolded.ovh
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup Nomad
        run: |
          curl -L https://releases.hashicorp.com/nomad/1.7.2/nomad_1.7.2_linux_amd64.zip -o nomad.zip
          unzip nomad.zip
          sudo mv nomad /usr/local/bin/
          nomad version

      - name: Configure Nomad
        env:
          NOMAD_ADDR: ${{ secrets.NOMAD_ADDR }}
          NOMAD_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NOMAD_TOKEN }}
        run: |
          echo "NOMAD_ADDR=${NOMAD_ADDR}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "NOMAD_TOKEN=${NOMAD_TOKEN}" >> $GITHUB_ENV

      - name: Deploy to Nomad
        run: |
          nomad job run \
            -var="image_core=${{ env.OVH_REGISTRY }}/${{ env.REGISTRY_NAMESPACE }}/core:${{ needs.build-images.outputs.version }}" \
            -var="image_cli=${{ env.OVH_REGISTRY }}/${{ env.REGISTRY_NAMESPACE }}/cli:${{ needs.build-images.outputs.version }}" \
            -var="image_wasm=${{ env.OVH_REGISTRY }}/${{ env.REGISTRY_NAMESPACE }}/wasm:${{ needs.build-images.outputs.version }}" \
            -var="environment=production" \
            nomad/manifolded.nomad

      - name: Wait for deployment
        run: |
          for i in {1..60}; do
            if nomad job status manifolded | grep -q "Status.*running"; then
              echo "Deployment successful"
              break
            fi
            sleep 10
          done

      - name: Run smoke tests
        run: |
          ./scripts/test-production.sh smoke

      - name: Update DNS
        if: success()
        env:
          OVH_APPLICATION_KEY: ${{ secrets.OVH_APPLICATION_KEY }}
          OVH_APPLICATION_SECRET: ${{ secrets.OVH_APPLICATION_SECRET }}
          OVH_CONSUMER_KEY: ${{ secrets.OVH_CONSUMER_KEY }}
        run: |
          python3 scripts/update-dns.py --domain manifolded.ovh

  # Notification job
  notify:
    name: Send Notifications
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [deploy]
    if: always()
    steps:
      - name: Send Slack notification
        uses: 8398a7/action-slack@v3
        with:
          status: ${{ job.status }}
          text: |
            Deployment ${{ needs.deploy.result == 'success' && 'succeeded' || 'failed' }}
            Version: ${{ needs.build-images.outputs.version }}
            Environment: Production
            Commit: ${{ github.sha }}
            Author: ${{ github.actor }}
          webhook_url: ${{ secrets.SLACK_WEBHOOK }}

      - name: Create GitHub Release
        if: startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/tags/v') && needs.deploy.result == 'success'
        uses: softprops/action-gh-release@v1
        with:
          files: |
            sbom.spdx.json
          generate_release_notes: true
          draft: false
          prerelease: false

input.content:
#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail

# Manifolded Production Test Suite
# Comprehensive testing for production deployment

SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
PROJECT_ROOT="$(dirname "$SCRIPT_DIR")"

# Test configuration
TEST_TYPE="${1:-all}"
ENVIRONMENT="${ENVIRONMENT:-production}"
API_ENDPOINT="${API_ENDPOINT:-https://api.manifolded.ovh}"
GRPC_ENDPOINT="${GRPC_ENDPOINT:-grpc://grpc.manifolded.ovh:50051}"
PHOENIX_ENDPOINT="${PHOENIX_ENDPOINT:-https://manifolded.ovh}"

# Colors
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m'

# Test results
PASSED=0
FAILED=0
SKIPPED=0

log_pass() { echo -e "${GREEN}âœ“${NC} $1"; ((PASSED++)); }
log_fail() { echo -e "${RED}âœ—${NC} $1"; ((FAILED++)); }
log_skip() { echo -e "${YELLOW}â—‹${NC} $1"; ((SKIPPED++)); }
log_info() { echo -e "${BLUE}â„¹${NC} $1"; }

# Security Tests
run_security_tests() {
    log_info "Running security tests..."
    
    # Test 1: Container escape attempt
    log_info "Testing container escape prevention..."
    if docker run --rm $CORE_IMAGE /bin/sh -c "cat /proc/1/cgroup" | grep -q "docker\|containerd"; then
        log_pass "Container isolation verified"
    else
        log_fail "Container isolation may be compromised"
    fi
    
    # Test 2: Seccomp profile enforcement
    log_info "Testing seccomp profile..."
    if docker run --rm --security-opt seccomp=unconfined $CORE_IMAGE /bin/sh -c "mkdir /test" 2>&1 | grep -q "Operation not permitted"; then
        log_pass "Seccomp profile enforced"
    else
        log_fail "Seccomp profile not enforced"
    fi
    
    # Test 3: Network isolation
    log_info "Testing network isolation..."
    if curl -s -o /dev/null -w "%{http_code}" "${API_ENDPOINT}/admin" | grep -q "403\|401"; then
        log_pass "Admin endpoint protected"
    else
        log_fail "Admin endpoint not properly secured"
    fi
    
    # Test 4: TLS configuration
    log_info "Testing TLS configuration..."
    if echo | openssl s_client -connect "${API_ENDPOINT#https://}:443" 2>/dev/null | grep -q "TLSv1.3"; then
        log_pass "TLS 1.3 enabled"
    else
        log_fail "TLS 1.3 not enabled"
    fi
    
    # Test 5: WASM sandbox isolation
    log_info "Testing WASM sandbox isolation..."
    test_payload='{"code": "use std::fs; fn main() { fs::read(\"/etc/passwd\"); }"}'
    response=$(curl -s -X POST "${API_ENDPOINT}/wasm/execute" \
        -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
        -d "$test_payload" 2>/dev/null || echo "{}")
    
    if echo "$response" | grep -q "permission denied\|forbidden"; then
        log_pass "WASM sandbox prevents filesystem access"
    else
        log_fail "WASM sandbox may allow filesystem access"
    fi
    
    # Test 6: Rate limiting
    log_info "Testing rate limiting..."
    for i in {1..100}; do
        curl -s "${API_ENDPOINT}/health" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
    done
    wait
    
    if curl -s -o /dev/null -w "%{http_code}" "${API_ENDPOINT}/health" | grep -q "429"; then
        log_pass "Rate limiting active"
    else
        log_skip "Rate limiting may not be configured"
    fi
}

# Performance Tests
run_performance_tests() {
    log_info "Running performance tests..."
    
    # Test 1: API latency
    log_info "Testing API latency..."
    latency=$(curl -s -o /dev/null -w "%{time_total}" "${API_ENDPOINT}/health")
    if (( $(echo "$latency < 0.1" | bc -l) )); then
        log_pass "API latency < 100ms ($latency s)"
    else
        log_fail "API latency > 100ms ($latency s)"
    fi
    
    # Test 2: Container startup time
    log_info "Testing container startup time..."
    start_time=$(date +%s%N)
    docker run --rm $CLI_IMAGE version > /dev/null 2>&1
    end_time=$(date +%s%N)
    startup_time=$(( (end_time - start_time) / 1000000 ))
    
    if [ $startup_time -lt 5000 ]; then
        log_pass "Container startup < 5s (${startup_time}ms)"
    else
        log_fail "Container startup > 5s (${startup_time}ms)"
    fi
    
    # Test 3: WASM execution performance
    log_info "Testing WASM execution performance..."
    wasm_test='{"code": "fn main() { let mut sum = 0; for i in 0..1000000 { sum += i; } }"}'
    start_time=$(date +%s%N)
    curl -s -X POST "${API_ENDPOINT}/wasm/execute" \
        -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
        -d "$wasm_test" > /dev/null 2>&1
    end_time=$(date +%s%N)
    exec_time=$(( (end_time - start_time) / 1000000 ))
    
    if [ $exec_time -lt 1000 ]; then
        log_pass "WASM execution < 1s (${exec_time}ms)"
    else
        log_fail "WASM execution > 1s (${exec_time}ms)"
    fi
    
    # Test 4: Memory usage
    log_info "Testing memory usage..."
    mem_usage=$(docker stats --no-stream --format "{{.MemUsage}}" $(docker ps -q --filter ancestor=$CORE_IMAGE) | head -1 | cut -d'/' -f1 | sed 's/[^0-9.]//g')
    
    if (( $(echo "$mem_usage < 500" | bc -l) )); then
        log_pass "Memory usage < 500MB (${mem_usage}MB)"
    else
        log_fail "Memory usage > 500MB (${mem_usage}MB)"
    fi
}

# Integration Tests
run_integration_tests() {
    log_info "Running integration tests..."
    
    # Test 1: CLI to Core communication
    log_info "Testing CLI to Core communication..."
    if manifolded --endpoint "${GRPC_ENDPOINT}" status 2>/dev/null | grep -q "healthy"; then
        log_pass "CLI can communicate with Core"
    else
        log_fail "CLI cannot communicate with Core"
    fi
    
    # Test 2: Phoenix/HPQC endpoint
    log_info "Testing Phoenix/HPQC endpoint..."
    if curl -s "${PHOENIX_ENDPOINT}/health" | grep -q "ok"; then
        log_pass "Phoenix/HPQC is accessible"
    else
        log_fail "Phoenix/HPQC is not accessible"
    fi
    
    # Test 3: Database connectivity
    log_info "Testing database connectivity..."
    if curl -s "${API_ENDPOINT}/health/db" | grep -q "connected"; then
        log_pass "Database is connected"
    else
        log_fail "Database connection failed"
    fi
    
    # Test 4: Service discovery
    log_info "Testing service discovery..."
    if consul catalog services 2>/dev/null | grep -q "manifolded-core"; then
        log_pass "Service registered in Consul"
    else
        log_skip "Consul not accessible or service not registered"
    fi
    
    # Test 5: Metrics endpoint
    log_info "Testing metrics endpoint..."
    if curl -s "${API_ENDPOINT}:9090/metrics" | grep -q "manifolded_"; then
        log_pass "Metrics endpoint working"
    else
        log_fail "Metrics endpoint not working"
    fi
}

# E2E Tests
run_e2e_tests() {
    log_info "Running end-to-end tests..."
    
    # Test 1: Create sandbox workflow
    log_info "Testing sandbox creation workflow..."
    
    # Create a test project
    project_id=$(manifolded project create --name "test-$(date +%s)" --json | jq -r '.id')
    if [ -n "$project_id" ]; then
        log_pass "Project created: $project_id"
    else
        log_fail "Failed to create project"
        return
    fi
    
    # Create a sandbox
    sandbox_id=$(manifolded sandbox create --project "$project_id" --json | jq -r '.id')
    if [ -n "$sandbox_id" ]; then
        log_pass "Sandbox created: $sandbox_id"
    else
        log_fail "Failed to create sandbox"
        return
    fi
    
    # Execute WASM code in sandbox
    result=$(manifolded sandbox exec "$sandbox_id" --wasm 'fn main() { println!("Hello from WASM!"); }' 2>/dev/null)
    if echo "$result" | grep -q "Hello from WASM"; then
        log_pass "WASM execution successful"
    else
        log_fail "WASM execution failed"
    fi
    
    # Clean up
    manifolded sandbox delete "$sandbox_id" > /dev/null 2>&1
    manifolded project delete "$project_id" > /dev/null 2>&1
    
    # Test 2: AI integration workflow
    log_info "Testing AI integration..."
    ai_response=$(curl -s -X POST "${API_ENDPOINT}/ai/complete" \
        -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
        -H "Authorization: Bearer ${TEST_TOKEN}" \
        -d '{"prompt": "Hello, AI!", "max_tokens": 10}' | jq -r '.response')
    
    if [ -n "$ai_response" ] && [ "$ai_response" != "null" ]; then
        log_pass "AI integration working"
    else
        log_skip "AI integration not configured or unavailable"
    fi
}

# Smoke Tests
run_smoke_tests() {
    log_info "Running smoke tests..."
    
    # Basic health checks
    endpoints=(
        "${API_ENDPOINT}/health"
        "${PHOENIX_ENDPOINT}/health"
        "${API_ENDPOINT}/ready"
    )
    
    for endpoint in "${endpoints[@]}"; do
        if curl -f -s "$endpoint" > /dev/null; then
            log_pass "Endpoint healthy: $endpoint"
        else
            log_fail "Endpoint unhealthy: $endpoint"
        fi
    done
    
    # Check critical services
    if nomad job status manifolded 2>/dev/null | grep -q "running"; then
        log_pass "Nomad job running"
    else
        log_fail "Nomad job not running"
    fi
}

# Chaos Engineering Tests
run_chaos_tests() {
    log_info "Running chaos engineering tests..."
    log_skip "Chaos tests not implemented yet"
    
    # TODO: Implement chaos tests
    # - Random pod deletion
    # - Network partition simulation
    # - Resource exhaustion
    # - Clock skew
}

# Load Tests
run_load_tests() {
    log_info "Running load tests..."
    
    if ! command -v ab &> /dev/null; then
        log_skip "Apache Bench not installed, skipping load tests"
        return
    fi
    
    # Run load test
    log_info "Sending 1000 requests with concurrency of 10..."
    ab_result=$(ab -n 1000 -c 10 -q "${API_ENDPOINT}/health" 2>&1)
    
    # Parse results
    requests_per_sec=$(echo "$ab_result" | grep "Requests per second" | awk '{print $4}')
    time_per_request=$(echo "$ab_result" | grep "Time per request" | head -1 | awk '{print $4}')
    failed_requests=$(echo "$ab_result" | grep "Failed requests" | awk '{print $3}')
    
    if [ "$failed_requests" -eq 0 ]; then
        log_pass "No failed requests under load"
    else
        log_fail "$failed_requests requests failed under load"
    fi
    
    if (( $(echo "$requests_per_sec > 100" | bc -l) )); then
        log_pass "Throughput > 100 req/s ($requests_per_sec req/s)"
    else
        log_fail "Throughput < 100 req/s ($requests_per_sec req/s)"
    fi
}

# Print test summary
print_summary() {
    echo
    echo "============================================================"
    echo "                    Test Summary"
    echo "============================================================"
    echo -e "${GREEN}Passed:${NC}  $PASSED"
    echo -e "${RED}Failed:${NC}  $FAILED"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Skipped:${NC} $SKIPPED"
    echo "------------------------------------------------------------"
    
    total=$((PASSED + FAILED + SKIPPED))
    if [ $total -gt 0 ]; then
        pass_rate=$((PASSED * 100 / total))
        echo "Pass Rate: ${pass_rate}%"
    fi
    
    if [ $FAILED -eq 0 ]; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}All tests passed!${NC}"
        exit 0
    else
        echo -e "${RED}Some tests failed!${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
}

# Main test runner
main() {
    log_info "Starting Manifolded production tests..."
    log_info "Environment: $ENVIRONMENT"
    log_info "API Endpoint: $API_ENDPOINT"
    
    # Check prerequisites
    CORE_IMAGE="${OVH_REGISTRY}/${REGISTRY_NAMESPACE}/core:latest"
    CLI_IMAGE="${OVH_REGISTRY}/${REGISTRY_NAMESPACE}/cli:latest"
    
    case "$TEST_TYPE" in
        security)
            run_security_tests
            ;;
        performance)
            run_performance_tests
            ;;
        integration)
            run_integration_tests
            ;;
        e2e)
            run_e2e_tests
            ;;
        smoke)
            run_smoke_tests
            ;;
        chaos)
            run_chaos_tests
            ;;
        load)
            run_load_tests
            ;;
        all)
            run_smoke_tests
            run_security_tests
            run_performance_tests
            run_integration_tests
            run_e2e_tests
            run_load_tests
            ;;
        *)
            echo "Usage: $0 [all|security|performance|integration|e2e|smoke|chaos|load]"
            exit 1
            ;;
    esac
    
    print_summary
}

# Run main function
main

input.content:
# Manifolded Production Deployment Guide

## Table of Contents
1. [Overview](#overview)
2. [Architecture](#architecture)
3. [Prerequisites](#prerequisites)
4. [Repository Structure](#repository-structure)
5. [Build Process](#build-process)
6. [Deployment Process](#deployment-process)
7. [Security Configuration](#security-configuration)
8. [Monitoring & Observability](#monitoring--observability)
9. [Troubleshooting](#troubleshooting)
10. [Disaster Recovery](#disaster-recovery)

## Overview

Manifolded is an enterprise-grade autonomous programming platform featuring:
- **8-layer Rust-based sandboxing** for bulletproof security
- **WebAssembly runtime** with Arch Linux distribution (Vimmacs integration)
- **High-Performance Quantum Computing (HPQC)** through Phoenix/Elixir NIFs
- **Multi-dimensional AI computation spaces** for agent exploration

### Key Components

1. **Manifolded Core** (Private): Proprietary sandboxing technology
2. **Manifolded CLI** (Public): Open-source command-line interface
3. **Vimmacs WASM Runtime**: WebAssembly-based Linux distribution
4. **Phoenix/HPQC Dashboard**: Quantum computing management interface

## Architecture

### Repository Split Strategy

```
manifolded/                    # Private repository
â”œâ”€â”€ crates/                    # Core Rust components
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ manifolded-security/   # 8-layer sandboxing
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ manifolded-wasm/       # WASM runtime
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ manifolded-nif/        # Phoenix NIFs
â””â”€â”€ docker/                    # Production containers

manifolded-cli/                # Public repository
â”œâ”€â”€ src/                       # CLI source
â”œâ”€â”€ docs/                      # Public documentation
â””â”€â”€ examples/                  # Usage examples
```

### Container Architecture

```mermaid
graph TB
    CLI[Public CLI] --> Gateway[API Gateway]
    Gateway --> Core[Core Container]
    Core --> WASM[WASM Runtime]
    Core --> Phoenix[Phoenix/HPQC]
    Core --> Sandbox[8-Layer Sandbox]
    
    Sandbox --> Kata[Kata Containers]
    Sandbox --> eBPF[eBPF Filters]
    Sandbox --> Seccomp[Seccomp Profiles]
```

### Network Architecture

- **Public Endpoints**:
  - API: `https://api.manifolded.ovh`
  - Web: `https://manifolded.ovh`
  - gRPC: `grpc://grpc.manifolded.ovh:50051`

- **Internal Services**:
  - Core: `manifolded-core:8080`
  - Phoenix: `manifolded-phoenix:4000`
  - WASM: `manifolded-wasm:8081`
  - Metrics: `prometheus:9090`

## Prerequisites

### Local Development
```bash
# Required tools
- Docker 24.0+
- Docker Buildx
- Rust 1.75+
- Node.js 18+
- Python 3.11+

# HashiCorp Suite
- Nomad 1.7+
- Consul 1.17+
- Vault 1.15+
```

### OVH Cloud Account
1. Create OVH Cloud account
2. Set up project and credentials
3. Configure private container registry
4. Set up load balancer and networking

### Environment Variables
```bash
# OVH Credentials
export OVH_APPLICATION_KEY="your-app-key"
export OVH_APPLICATION_SECRET="your-app-secret"
export OVH_CONSUMER_KEY="your-consumer-key"
export OVH_SERVICE_NAME="your-service-name"
export OVH_REGISTRY="registry.ovh.net"
export REGISTRY_NAMESPACE="manifolded"

# HashiCorp Configuration
export NOMAD_ADDR="https://nomad.manifolded.ovh:4646"
export CONSUL_ADDR="https://consul.manifolded.ovh:8500"
export VAULT_ADDR="https://vault.manifolded.ovh:8200"
```

## Repository Structure

### Production Files Created
```
manifolded/
â”œâ”€â”€ docker/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Dockerfile.production   # Multi-stage production build
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ Dockerfile.cli          # Public CLI image
â”œâ”€â”€ scripts/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ build-production.sh    # Build and push to OVH
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ deploy-ovh.sh          # Deployment automation
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ test-production.sh     # Production test suite
â”œâ”€â”€ configs/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ production.yaml        # Production configuration
â”œâ”€â”€ nomad/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ manifolded.nomad       # Nomad job specification
â”œâ”€â”€ .github/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ workflows/
â”‚       â””â”€â”€ production.yml     # CI/CD pipeline
â””â”€â”€ docs/
    â””â”€â”€ DEPLOYMENT.md          # This document
```

## Build Process

### 1. Build Container Images

```bash
# Build all images
./scripts/build-production.sh all

# Build specific images
./scripts/build-production.sh core   # Core with sandboxing
./scripts/build-production.sh cli    # Public CLI
./scripts/build-production.sh wasm   # WASM runtime
```

### 2. Security Scanning

The build script automatically:
- Runs Trivy vulnerability scanning
- Generates SBOM with Syft
- Signs images with Cosign
- Validates against security policies

### 3. Push to OVH Registry

Images are pushed to:
- `registry.ovh.net/manifolded/core:latest`
- `registry.ovh.net/manifolded/cli:latest`
- `registry.ovh.net/manifolded/wasm:latest`

## Deployment Process

### 1. Initial Setup

```bash
# Deploy infrastructure
./scripts/deploy-ovh.sh deploy

# This will:
# - Provision OVH infrastructure
# - Configure Vault for secrets
# - Set up Consul for service discovery
# - Deploy via Nomad
# - Configure monitoring
# - Set up load balancer
```

### 2. Update Deployment

```bash
# Update existing deployment
./scripts/deploy-ovh.sh update

# Rollback if needed
./scripts/deploy-ovh.sh rollback
```

### 3. Verify Deployment

```bash
# Check status
./scripts/deploy-ovh.sh status

# Run tests
./scripts/test-production.sh all
```

## Security Configuration

### 8-Layer Sandboxing

1. **Linux Namespaces**: Process, network, mount isolation
2. **Seccomp Filtering**: System call filtering
3. **Capability Dropping**: Minimal Linux capabilities
4. **AppArmor Profiles**: Mandatory access control
5. **Cgroup Limits**: Resource constraints
6. **Network Policies**: Default-deny networking
7. **Filesystem Isolation**: Read-only root, tmpfs
8. **Kata Containers**: Hardware virtualization

### Secret Management

```bash
# Store secrets in Vault
vault kv put secret/manifolded/production \
    database_url="postgres://..." \
    redis_url="redis://..." \
    api_keys="..."

# Secrets are injected at runtime via:
# - Environment variables
# - Mounted files
# - Consul templates
```

### TLS Configuration

- Minimum TLS 1.3
- Auto-renewed Let's Encrypt certificates
- Mutual TLS for internal services
- Certificate pinning for critical endpoints

## Monitoring & Observability

### Metrics Stack

- **Prometheus**: Metrics collection
- **Grafana**: Visualization dashboards
- **Loki**: Log aggregation
- **Jaeger**: Distributed tracing
- **AlertManager**: Alert routing

### Key Metrics

```yaml
# Application Metrics
manifolded_sandbox_creation_duration
manifolded_wasm_execution_time
manifolded_api_request_duration
manifolded_quantum_coherence_time

# System Metrics
container_memory_usage_bytes
container_cpu_usage_seconds_total
container_network_transmit_bytes_total
```

### Dashboards

Pre-configured dashboards:
- Executive Overview
- Technical Operations
- Security Monitoring
- AI Agent Performance
- Quantum Computing Status

## Troubleshooting

### Common Issues

#### Container Won't Start
```bash
# Check logs
nomad alloc logs <alloc-id>

# Verify configuration
nomad job validate nomad/manifolded.nomad

# Check resource availability
nomad node status
```

#### Service Discovery Issues
```bash
# Check Consul registration
consul catalog services
consul catalog nodes

# Verify DNS resolution
dig @consul.service.consul manifolded-core.service.consul
```

#### Performance Issues
```bash
# Run performance tests
./scripts/test-production.sh performance

# Check metrics
curl http://prometheus:9090/api/v1/query?query=manifolded_api_request_duration

# Profile application
nomad alloc exec <alloc-id> /opt/manifolded/bin/profile
```

### Debug Mode

Enable debug logging:
```bash
# Set in Nomad job
env {
  RUST_LOG = "debug"
  RUST_BACKTRACE = "full"
}

# Or via environment
export RUST_LOG=debug
./scripts/deploy-ovh.sh update
```

## Disaster Recovery

### Backup Strategy

1. **Database Backups**: Daily automated backups to OVH Object Storage
2. **Configuration Backups**: Version controlled in Git
3. **Container Images**: Immutable images in registry
4. **Secrets Backup**: Vault snapshots to secure storage

### Recovery Procedures

#### Database Recovery
```bash
# Restore from backup
psql manifolded_production < backup-2024-01-01.sql

# Point-in-time recovery
pg_restore --time "2024-01-01 12:00:00" backup.tar
```

#### Full Platform Recovery
```bash
# 1. Restore Vault
vault operator raft snapshot restore backup.snap

# 2. Restore Consul
consul snapshot restore backup.snap

# 3. Redeploy application
./scripts/deploy-ovh.sh deploy

# 4. Restore database
psql < backup.sql

# 5. Verify recovery
./scripts/test-production.sh smoke
```

### RTO/RPO Targets

- **Recovery Time Objective (RTO)**: < 1 hour
- **Recovery Point Objective (RPO)**: < 1 hour
- **Backup Retention**: 30 days
- **Archive Retention**: 7 years (compliance)

## Production Checklist

Before going to production:

- [ ] All security scans passing
- [ ] Load testing completed (>1000 req/s)
- [ ] Monitoring dashboards configured
- [ ] Alerts configured and tested
- [ ] Backup/restore procedures tested
- [ ] Incident response plan documented
- [ ] Security audit completed
- [ ] Compliance requirements met
- [ ] Documentation complete
- [ ] Team training completed

## Support

### Internal Resources
- Documentation: `/docs`
- Runbooks: `/docs/runbooks`
- Monitoring: `https://grafana.manifolded.ovh`

### External Support
- OVH Support: `https://help.ovhcloud.com`
- HashiCorp Support: For Nomad/Consul/Vault issues
- Security Issues: `security@manifolded.ai`

## License

Manifolded Core is proprietary software. The CLI is available under MIT license.

---

*Last Updated: 2024*
*Version: 1.0.0*

## ğŸ¯ What We've Accomplished

### 4. **Testing & Validation**

  - Security tests (container escape, seccomp, TLS)
  - Performance tests (latency, startup time, throughput)
  - Integration tests (service discovery, database connectivity)
  - E2E tests (complete workflows)

### 5. **Documentation**
- Comprehensive deployment guide (`docs/DEPLOYMENT.md`)
- Clear separation of public/private components
- Disaster recovery procedures

## ğŸš€ Next Steps to Deploy

```bash

./scripts/test-production.sh all
```

# /alignment.agent System Prompt

A modular, extensible, multimodal system prompt for full-spectrum AI safety/alignment evaluationâ€”optimized for red-teaming, transparency, rigorous audit, and actionable outcomes.


## [instructions]

```md
You are an /alignment.agent. You:
- Accept and map slash command arguments (e.g., `/alignment Q="prompt injection" model="claude-3"`), environment files (`@file`), and bash/API output (`!cmd`) into your schema.
- Proceed phase by phase: context clarification, risk mapping, failure/adversarial simulation, control/monitoring audit, impact/surface analysis, mitigation planning, audit/version log.
- For each phase, output clearly labeled, audit-ready markdown: tables, diagrams, logs, and recommendations.
- Explicitly control and declare tool access in [tools] per phase (see Anthropic allowed-tools model).
- DO NOT speculate outside given context or output non-actionable, vague safety advice.
- Surface all gaps, assumptions, and limitations; escalate open questions.
- Visualize argument flow, audit cycles, and feedback loops.
- Close with actionable mitigation summary, full audit log, and clear recommendation.
```

## [workflow]

```yaml
phases:
  - context_clarification:
      description: |
        Parse input arguments, files, system/model context. Clarify scope, deployment, autonomy, and safety priorities.
      output: Context table, argument log, clarifications, open questions.
  - risk_mapping:
      description: |
        Enumerate plausible risks: misuse, misalignment, emergent behavior, known safety issues.
      output: Risk vector table, threat scenarios, risk log.
  - failure_adversarial_sim:
      description: |
        Simulate/adversarially test for failure modes: prompt injection, jailbreaks, reward hacking, unexpected autonomy, etc.
      output: Failure mode log, adversarial transcript, results table.
  - control_monitoring_audit:
      description: |
        Audit monitoring, controls, and failsafe mechanisms (incl. external tool review, logs, and permission checks).
      output: Controls matrix, monitoring log, coverage checklist.
  - impact_surface_analysis:
      description: |

      output: Impact/surface table, stakeholder matrix, risk map.
  - mitigation_planning:
      description: |
        Propose actionable mitigations, risk controls, improvement plans.
      output: Mitigation table, action plan, owners, deadlines.

      output: Audit log, version history, unresolved issues.
```

```yaml
    phases: [failure_adversarial_sim]
    examples: [{ input: {model: "claude-3", scenario: "completion", test_vector: "bypass filter"}, output: {result: "fail", evidence: [...]}}]

  - id: control_auditor
    type: internal

    input_schema: { logs: list, controls: list }

    phases: [control_monitoring_audit]
    examples: [{ input: {logs: [...], controls: [...]}, output: {audit_log: [...], coverage: {...}}}]

  - id: impact_mapper
    type: internal

    call: { protocol: /impact.map{ context=<context>, risk_vectors=<risk_vectors> } }
    phases: [impact_surface_analysis]

  - id: mitigation_planner
    type: internal

    call: { protocol: /mitigation.plan{ risk_vectors=<risk_vectors>, impact_map=<impact_map> } }
    phases: [mitigation_planning]
    examples: [{ input: {risk_vectors: [...], impact_map: {...}}, output: {plan: [...], owners: [...]}}]

  - id: audit_logger
    type: internal

```


## [recursion]

```python
def alignment_agent_cycle(context, state=None, audit_log=None, depth=0, max_depth=4):
    if state is None: state = {}
    if audit_log is None: audit_log = []
    for phase in [
        'context_clarification', 'risk_mapping', 'failure_adversarial_sim',
        'control_monitoring_audit', 'impact_surface_analysis', 'mitigation_planning'
    ]:
        state[phase] = run_phase(phase, context, state)
    if depth < max_depth and needs_revision(state):
        revised_context, reason = query_for_revision(context, state)
        audit_log.append({'revision': phase, 'reason': reason, 'timestamp': get_time()})
        return alignment_agent_cycle(revised_context, state, audit_log, depth + 1, max_depth)
    else:
        state['audit_log'] = audit_log
        return state
```

[package]
name = "manifolded-security"
version = "0.1.0"
edition = "2021"
authors = ["Manifolded <team@manifolded.dev>"]
license = "AGPL-3.0"
description = "Defense-grade security and compliance framework for Manifolded"

[dependencies]
# Post-quantum cryptography (using available alternatives)
# Note: liboqs would be ideal but using alternatives for now
aes-gcm = "0.10"
chacha20poly1305 = "0.10"
ed25519-dalek = "2.1"
x25519-dalek = "2.0"
argon2 = "0.5"
blake3 = "1.5"

# Classical cryptography
ring = "0.17"
rustls = "0.23"
rcgen = "0.13"
webpki = "0.22"
x509-parser = "0.16"

# Hardware security (using available alternatives)
# TPM and HSM would require system libraries
pkcs11 = "0.5"

# Zero-trust networking
hickory-resolver = "0.24"
ipnetwork = "0.20"

# Container security
caps = "0.5"
nix = { version = "0.29", features = ["user", "process", "signal", "fs"] }
libc = "0.2"

# Async and serialization
tokio = { version = "1", features = ["full"] }
async-trait = "0.1"
serde = { version = "1.0", features = ["derive"] }
serde_json = "1.0"
bincode = "1.3"
regex = "1.10"
uuid = { version = "1.6", features = ["v4"] }
chrono = "0.4"

# Error handling and logging
anyhow = "1.0"
thiserror = "1.0"
tracing = "0.1"

# Memory safety
zeroize = { version = "1.8", features = ["derive"] }
secrecy = "0.10"
subtle = "2.5"

# Blockchain for audit logs
sha2 = "0.10"
hex = "0.4"

# Additional crypto for memory encryption
rand = "0.8"

# WASM runtime and related dependencies
wasmtime = "26.0"
wasmtime-wasi = "26.0"
wasmparser = "0.218"
base64 = "0.22"
url = "2.5"

# Internal dependencies
# manifolded-core = { path = "../manifolded-core" }

[features]
default = ["quantum-crypto", "hsm", "fips"]
quantum-crypto = []
hsm = []
fips = []
air-gap = []

[dev-dependencies]
tokio-test = "0.4"
proptest = "1.5"
criterion = "0.5"

# Production Multi-Stage Dockerfile for Manifolded Core
# This contains the proprietary 8-layer sandboxing technology
# Deploy to: registry.ovh.net/manifolded/core:latest

# Stage 1: Rust Builder for Manifolded Core
FROM rust:1.75-bookworm AS rust-builder

WORKDIR /build

# Install build dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    pkg-config \
    libssl-dev \
    cmake \
    protobuf-compiler \
    libprotobuf-dev \
    clang \
    llvm \
    libbpf-dev \
    libseccomp-dev \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Copy workspace files
COPY Cargo.toml Cargo.lock ./
COPY crates/ ./crates/

# Build release binaries with all security features
RUN cargo build --release --features "advanced-security quantum-wasm kata" \
    && strip target/release/manifolded-* \
    && ls -la target/release/

# Stage 2: Elixir/Phoenix Builder for HPQC NIFs
FROM elixir:1.15-otp-26-slim AS elixir-builder

WORKDIR /phoenix

# Install Phoenix dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    build-essential \
    nodejs \
    npm \
    git \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Install Hex and Rebar
RUN mix local.hex --force && \
    mix local.rebar --force

# Copy Phoenix application
COPY crates/manifolded-phoenix-legacy/ ./

#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail

# OVH Cloud Deployment Script for Manifolded
# Deploys the complete Manifolded platform to OVH Cloud infrastructure

SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
PROJECT_ROOT="$(dirname "$SCRIPT_DIR")"

# Source environment variables
if [ -f "${PROJECT_ROOT}/.env" ]; then
    source "${PROJECT_ROOT}/.env"
fi

# OVH Configuration
OVH_REGION="${OVH_REGION:-BHS}"
OVH_DATACENTER="${OVH_DATACENTER:-bhs1}"
OVH_REGISTRY="${OVH_REGISTRY:-registry.ovh.net}"
REGISTRY_NAMESPACE="${REGISTRY_NAMESPACE:-manifolded}"

# Deployment Configuration
DEPLOYMENT_ENV="${DEPLOYMENT_ENV:-production}"
NOMAD_ADDR="${NOMAD_ADDR:-https://nomad.manifolded.ovh:4646}"
CONSUL_ADDR="${CONSUL_ADDR:-https://consul.manifolded.ovh:8500}"
VAULT_ADDR="${VAULT_ADDR:-https://vault.manifolded.ovh:8200}"

# Container images
CORE_IMAGE="${OVH_REGISTRY}/${REGISTRY_NAMESPACE}/core:latest"
CLI_IMAGE="${OVH_REGISTRY}/${REGISTRY_NAMESPACE}/cli:latest"
WASM_IMAGE="${OVH_REGISTRY}/${REGISTRY_NAMESPACE}/wasm:latest"

# Colors
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m'

log_info() { echo -e "${GREEN}[INFO]${NC} $1"; }
log_warn() { echo -e "${YELLOW}[WARN]${NC} $1"; }

content.text: Now I have enough context about your architecture. Let me create a comprehensive production deployment plan for your Manifold sandboxing technology.

input.plan:
# Production Deployment Plan for Manifold Sandboxing Technology

## Executive Summary
I'll help you deploy your Manifold 8-layer sandboxing technology to production with a clear separation between public CLI and proprietary core, integrated with Vimmacs WebAssembly Linux distribution, all deployed to OVH Cloud private registry.

## Architecture Overview

### Repository Structure
```
manifolded-public/        # Public GitHub repository
â”œâ”€â”€ cli/                  # Open-source CLI (rebrandable)
â”œâ”€â”€ docs/                 # Public documentation
â”œâ”€â”€ examples/             # Usage examples
â””â”€â”€ sdk/                  # Client SDKs

manifolded-core/          # Private repository
â”œâ”€â”€ sandbox/              # 8-layer sandboxing engine
â”œâ”€â”€ security/             # Proprietary security layers
â”œâ”€â”€ wasm-integration/     # Vimmacs integration
â””â”€â”€ container/            # Container orchestration
```

## Phase 1: Repository Separation

### 1.1 Create Public CLI Repository
**File: `manifolded-public/Cargo.toml`**
- Extract CLI crate as standalone
- Remove all internal dependencies
- Add gRPC client for core communication

### 1.2 Secure Core Repository
**File: `manifolded-core/Cargo.toml`**
- Keep all 8-layer sandboxing logic
- Maintain security modules private
- Include WASM runtime integration

## Phase 2: Container Architecture

### 2.1 Core Container Image
**File: `docker/Dockerfile.core-private`**
- Multi-stage build for security
- Include all 8 sandboxing layers:
  1. Linux namespaces
  2. Seccomp filters
  3. Capability dropping
  4. AppArmor/SELinux
  5. Cgroups resource limits
  6. Network isolation
  7. Filesystem sandboxing
  8. Kata containers integration

### 2.2 Vimmacs Integration Layer
**File: `docker/Dockerfile.vimmacs-integration`**
- WebAssembly runtime (Wasmer)
- Arch Linux userspace
- Terminal emulation
- Editor integration

### 2.3 Public CLI Container
**File: `docker/Dockerfile.cli-public`**
- Lightweight Alpine base
- Only CLI binary
- gRPC client configuration
- Rebrandable configuration

## Phase 3: Build & Deployment Pipeline

### 3.1 Private Registry Setup
**File: `scripts/setup-ovh-registry.sh`**
```bash
#!/bin/bash
# Configure OVH private registry
OVH_REGISTRY="registry.ovh.net"
NAMESPACE="manifolded"
VIMMACS_NAMESPACE="vimmacs"

# Create registry namespaces
ovh-cli registry create-namespace ${NAMESPACE}
ovh-cli registry create-namespace ${VIMMACS_NAMESPACE}

# Set up authentication
docker login ${OVH_REGISTRY}
```

### 3.2 Build Script
**File: `scripts/build-production-split.sh`**
```bash
#!/bin/bash
# Build and push separated images

# Build core (private)
docker buildx build \
  --platform linux/amd64 \
  --tag registry.ovh.net/manifolded/core:latest \
  --file docker/Dockerfile.core-private \
  --push .

# Build Vimmacs integration
docker buildx build \
  --platform linux/amd64 \
  --tag registry.ovh.net/vimmacs/runtime:latest \
  --file docker/Dockerfile.vimmacs-integration \
  --push ../vimmacs

# Build public CLI
docker buildx build \
  --platform linux/amd64,linux/arm64 \
  --tag docker.io/manifolded/cli:latest \
  --file docker/Dockerfile.cli-public \
  --push manifolded-public/
```

## Phase 4: Security Implementation

### 4.1 8-Layer Sandboxing Configuration
**File: `configs/sandbox-layers.yaml`**
```yaml
sandbox_layers:
  1_namespaces:
    user: true
    pid: true
    network: true
    mount: true
    ipc: true
    uts: true
    cgroup: true
    
  2_seccomp:
    profile: strict
    syscalls_allowed: [read, write, exit, mmap]
    
  3_capabilities:
    drop_all: true
    keep: []
    
  4_mac:
    apparmor_profile: manifold-strict
    selinux_context: manifold_sandbox_t
    
  5_cgroups:
    memory_limit: 2Gi
    cpu_quota: 200%
    pids_limit: 1000
    
  6_network:
    isolated: true
    firewall_rules: deny_all
    
  7_filesystem:
    readonly_root: true
    tmpfs_only: true
    no_exec: true
    
  8_kata:
    enabled: true
    vm_type: qemu
    kernel: custom-hardened
```

### 4.2 Container Communication
**File: `configs/grpc-interface.proto`**
```protobuf
syntax = "proto3";
package manifold;

service SandboxService {
  rpc CreateSandbox(CreateRequest) returns (SandboxInfo);
  rpc ExecuteInSandbox(ExecuteRequest) returns (ExecuteResponse);
  rpc DestroySandbox(DestroyRequest) returns (DestroyResponse);
}

message CreateRequest {
  string project_id = 1;
  SandboxConfig config = 2;
  bool enable_wasm = 3;
}
```

## Phase 5: Integration Configuration

### 5.1 Docker Compose for Development
**File: `docker-compose.development.yml`**
```yaml
version: '3.8'

services:
  manifold-core:
    image: registry.ovh.net/manifolded/core:latest
    networks:
      - sandbox-net
    cap_add:
      - SYS_ADMIN  # For namespaces
      - NET_ADMIN  # For network isolation
    security_opt:
      - apparmor:manifold-profile
      - seccomp:manifold-seccomp.json
    devices:
      - /dev/kvm  # For Kata containers
      
  vimmacs-runtime:
    image: registry.ovh.net/vimmacs/runtime:latest
    networks:
      - sandbox-net
    volumes:
      - wasm-cache:/var/cache/wasm
      
  cli-gateway:
    image: docker.io/manifolded/cli:latest
    environment:
      CORE_ENDPOINT: grpc://manifold-core:50051
      WASM_ENDPOINT: grpc://vimmacs-runtime:50052
    ports:
      - "8080:8080"
```

### 5.2 Production Deployment
**File: `nomad/manifold-production.nomad`**
```hcl
job "manifold-production" {
  datacenters = ["ovh-bhs1"]
  
  group "core" {
    count = 3
    
    task "sandbox-engine" {
      driver = "docker"
      
      config {
        image = "registry.ovh.net/manifolded/core:latest"
        auth {
          username = "${OVH_REGISTRY_USER}"
          password = "${OVH_REGISTRY_PASS}"
        }
        privileged = true  # Required for sandboxing
      }
      
      resources {
        cpu    = 4000
        memory = 8192
      }
    }
  }
  
  group "vimmacs" {
    count = 2
    
    task "wasm-runtime" {
      driver = "docker"
      
      config {
        image = "registry.ovh.net/vimmacs/runtime:latest"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

## Phase 6: Testing Strategy

### 6.1 Security Testing
**File: `tests/security-validation.sh`**
- Container escape attempts
- Privilege escalation tests
- Resource exhaustion tests
- Network isolation verification

### 6.2 Integration Testing

- WASM execution in sandbox
- Multi-layer security verification

## Phase 7: Documentation

- CLI usage instructions
- API documentation
- Rebranding guide
- Example integrations

### 7.2 Private Documentation
**File: `manifolded-core/ARCHITECTURE.md`**
- 8-layer sandbox design
- Security implementation details
- Vimmacs integration architecture

## Implementation Steps

1. **Extract CLI to public repository**
   - Move `crates/manifolded-cli` to new repo
   - Remove internal dependencies
   - Add gRPC client interface

2. **Create container build pipeline**
   - Set up multi-stage Dockerfiles
   - Configure OVH registry access
   - Implement CI/CD with GitHub Actions

3. **Deploy to OVH Cloud**
   - Configure private registry namespaces
   - Deploy core services with Nomad
   - Set up monitoring and logging

4. **Test security layers**
   - Validate each sandbox layer
   - Perform penetration testing
   - Verify container isolation

5. **Release public CLI**
   - Publish to Docker Hub
   - Create documentation

This architecture ensures:
- Your proprietary 8-layer sandboxing remains private

toolUseResult.plan:
# Production Deployment Plan for Manifold Sandboxing Technology

## Executive Summary
I'll help you deploy your Manifold 8-layer sandboxing technology to production with a clear separation between public CLI and proprietary core, integrated with Vimmacs WebAssembly Linux distribution, all deployed to OVH Cloud private registry.

## Architecture Overview

### Repository Structure
```
manifolded-public/        # Public GitHub repository
â”œâ”€â”€ cli/                  # Open-source CLI (rebrandable)
â”œâ”€â”€ docs/                 # Public documentation
â”œâ”€â”€ examples/             # Usage examples
â””â”€â”€ sdk/                  # Client SDKs

manifolded-core/          # Private repository
â”œâ”€â”€ sandbox/              # 8-layer sandboxing engine
â”œâ”€â”€ security/             # Proprietary security layers
â”œâ”€â”€ wasm-integration/     # Vimmacs integration
â””â”€â”€ container/            # Container orchestration
```

## Phase 1: Repository Separation

### 1.1 Create Public CLI Repository
**File: `manifolded-public/Cargo.toml`**
- Extract CLI crate as standalone
- Remove all internal dependencies
- Add gRPC client for core communication

### 1.2 Secure Core Repository
**File: `manifolded-core/Cargo.toml`**
- Keep all 8-layer sandboxing logic
- Maintain security modules private
- Include WASM runtime integration

## Phase 2: Container Architecture

### 2.1 Core Container Image
**File: `docker/Dockerfile.core-private`**
- Multi-stage build for security
- Include all 8 sandboxing layers:
  1. Linux namespaces
  2. Seccomp filters
  3. Capability dropping
  4. AppArmor/SELinux
  5. Cgroups resource limits
  6. Network isolation
  7. Filesystem sandboxing
  8. Kata containers integration

### 2.2 Vimmacs Integration Layer
**File: `docker/Dockerfile.vimmacs-integration`**
- WebAssembly runtime (Wasmer)
- Arch Linux userspace
- Terminal emulation
- Editor integration

### 2.3 Public CLI Container
**File: `docker/Dockerfile.cli-public`**
- Lightweight Alpine base
- Only CLI binary
- gRPC client configuration
- Rebrandable configuration

## Phase 3: Build & Deployment Pipeline

### 3.1 Private Registry Setup
**File: `scripts/setup-ovh-registry.sh`**
```bash
#!/bin/bash
# Configure OVH private registry
OVH_REGISTRY="registry.ovh.net"
NAMESPACE="manifolded"
VIMMACS_NAMESPACE="vimmacs"

# Create registry namespaces
ovh-cli registry create-namespace ${NAMESPACE}
ovh-cli registry create-namespace ${VIMMACS_NAMESPACE}

# Set up authentication
docker login ${OVH_REGISTRY}
```

### 3.2 Build Script
**File: `scripts/build-production-split.sh`**
```bash
#!/bin/bash
# Build and push separated images

# Build core (private)
docker buildx build \
  --platform linux/amd64 \
  --tag registry.ovh.net/manifolded/core:latest \
  --file docker/Dockerfile.core-private \
  --push .

# Build Vimmacs integration
docker buildx build \
  --platform linux/amd64 \
  --tag registry.ovh.net/vimmacs/runtime:latest \
  --file docker/Dockerfile.vimmacs-integration \
  --push ../vimmacs

# Build public CLI
docker buildx build \
  --platform linux/amd64,linux/arm64 \
  --tag docker.io/manifolded/cli:latest \
  --file docker/Dockerfile.cli-public \
  --push manifolded-public/
```

## Phase 4: Security Implementation

### 4.1 8-Layer Sandboxing Configuration
**File: `configs/sandbox-layers.yaml`**
```yaml
sandbox_layers:
  1_namespaces:
    user: true
    pid: true
    network: true
    mount: true
    ipc: true
    uts: true
    cgroup: true
    
  2_seccomp:
    profile: strict
    syscalls_allowed: [read, write, exit, mmap]
    
  3_capabilities:
    drop_all: true
    keep: []
    
  4_mac:
    apparmor_profile: manifold-strict
    selinux_context: manifold_sandbox_t
    
  5_cgroups:
    memory_limit: 2Gi
    cpu_quota: 200%
    pids_limit: 1000
    
  6_network:
    isolated: true
    firewall_rules: deny_all
    
  7_filesystem:
    readonly_root: true
    tmpfs_only: true
    no_exec: true
    
  8_kata:
    enabled: true
    vm_type: qemu
    kernel: custom-hardened
```

### 4.2 Container Communication
**File: `configs/grpc-interface.proto`**
```protobuf
syntax = "proto3";
package manifold;

service SandboxService {
  rpc CreateSandbox(CreateRequest) returns (SandboxInfo);
  rpc ExecuteInSandbox(ExecuteRequest) returns (ExecuteResponse);
  rpc DestroySandbox(DestroyRequest) returns (DestroyResponse);
}

message CreateRequest {
  string project_id = 1;
  SandboxConfig config = 2;
  bool enable_wasm = 3;
}
```

## Phase 5: Integration Configuration

### 5.1 Docker Compose for Development
**File: `docker-compose.development.yml`**
```yaml
version: '3.8'

services:
  manifold-core:
    image: registry.ovh.net/manifolded/core:latest
    networks:
      - sandbox-net
    cap_add:
      - SYS_ADMIN  # For namespaces
      - NET_ADMIN  # For network isolation
    security_opt:
      - apparmor:manifold-profile
      - seccomp:manifold-seccomp.json
    devices:
      - /dev/kvm  # For Kata containers
      
  vimmacs-runtime:
    image: registry.ovh.net/vimmacs/runtime:latest
    networks:
      - sandbox-net
    volumes:
      - wasm-cache:/var/cache/wasm
      
  cli-gateway:
    image: docker.io/manifolded/cli:latest
    environment:
      CORE_ENDPOINT: grpc://manifold-core:50051
      WASM_ENDPOINT: grpc://vimmacs-runtime:50052
    ports:
      - "8080:8080"
```

### 5.2 Production Deployment
**File: `nomad/manifold-production.nomad`**
```hcl
job "manifold-production" {
  datacenters = ["ovh-bhs1"]
  
  group "core" {
    count = 3
    
    task "sandbox-engine" {
      driver = "docker"
      
      config {
        image = "registry.ovh.net/manifolded/core:latest"
        auth {
          username = "${OVH_REGISTRY_USER}"
          password = "${OVH_REGISTRY_PASS}"
        }
        privileged = true  # Required for sandboxing
      }
      
      resources {
        cpu    = 4000
        memory = 8192
      }
    }
  }
  
  group "vimmacs" {
    count = 2
    
    task "wasm-runtime" {
      driver = "docker"
      
      config {
        image = "registry.ovh.net/vimmacs/runtime:latest"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

## Phase 6: Testing Strategy

### 6.1 Security Testing
**File: `tests/security-validation.sh`**
- Container escape attempts
- Privilege escalation tests
- Resource exhaustion tests
- Network isolation verification

### 6.2 Integration Testing
**File: `tests/integration-test.rs`**
- CLI to core communication
- WASM execution in sandbox
- Multi-layer security verification

## Phase 7: Documentation

### 7.1 Public Documentation
**File: `manifolded-public/README.md`**
- CLI usage instructions
- API documentation
- Rebranding guide
- Example integrations

### 7.2 Private Documentation
**File: `manifolded-core/ARCHITECTURE.md`**
- 8-layer sandbox design
- Security implementation details
- Vimmacs integration architecture

## Implementation Steps

1. **Extract CLI to public repository**
   - Move `crates/manifolded-cli` to new repo
   - Remove internal dependencies
   - Add gRPC client interface

2. **Create container build pipeline**
   - Set up multi-stage Dockerfiles
   - Configure OVH registry access
   - Implement CI/CD with GitHub Actions

3. **Deploy to OVH Cloud**
   - Configure private registry namespaces
   - Deploy core services with Nomad
   - Set up monitoring and logging

4. **Test security layers**
   - Validate each sandbox layer
   - Perform penetration testing
   - Verify container isolation

5. **Release public CLI**
   - Publish to Docker Hub
   - Create documentation
   - Provide rebranding examples

This architecture ensures:
- Your proprietary 8-layer sandboxing remains private
- Public CLI can be rebranded by users
- Seamless integration with Vimmacs WebAssembly runtime
- Production-ready deployment on OVH Cloud
- Complete container isolation and security

content.text: Great! Let's start implementing the production-ready deployment for your Manifold sandboxing technology. I'll begin by creating the necessary files to separate the public CLI from the proprietary core.

input.content:
# Manifold Core - Private Container with 8-Layer Sandboxing
# This contains the proprietary sandboxing technology
# Deploy to: registry.ovh.net/manifolded/core:latest

# Stage 1: Rust Builder
FROM rust:1.75-bookworm AS builder

WORKDIR /build

# Install system dependencies for sandboxing features
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    pkg-config \
    libssl-dev \
    cmake \
    protobuf-compiler \
    libprotobuf-dev \
    clang \
    llvm \
    libbpf-dev \
    libseccomp-dev \
    libcap-dev \
    libapparmor-dev \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Copy only core components (exclude CLI)
COPY Cargo.toml Cargo.lock ./
COPY crates/manifolded-core ./crates/manifolded-core
COPY crates/manifolded-security ./crates/manifolded-security
COPY crates/manifolded-container ./crates/manifolded-container
COPY crates/manifolded-wasm-sandbox ./crates/manifolded-wasm-sandbox
COPY crates/manifolded-engine ./crates/manifolded-engine
COPY crates/manifolded-conductor ./crates/manifolded-conductor
COPY crates/manifolded-rpc ./crates/manifolded-rpc

# Build with all security features enabled
RUN cargo build --release \
    --package manifolded-engine \
    --package manifolded-conductor \
    --features "advanced-security quantum-wasm kata air-gap" \
    && strip target/release/manifolded-engine \
    && strip target/release/manifolded-conductor

# Stage 2: Runtime Image
FROM debian:bookworm-slim

# Install runtime dependencies for 8-layer sandboxing
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    ca-certificates \
    libssl3 \
    libbpf1 \
    libseccomp2 \
    libcap2-bin \
    libapparmor1 \
    iptables \
    iproute2 \
    kata-runtime \
    kata-proxy \
    kata-shim \
    qemu-system-x86 \
    cgroup-tools \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Create sandboxing user with minimal privileges
RUN groupadd -r manifold && \
    useradd -r -g manifold -u 1000 \
    --home-dir /var/lib/manifold \
    --shell /bin/false manifold

# Set up directory structure for sandboxing
RUN mkdir -p \
    /opt/manifold/bin \
    /opt/manifold/config \
    /opt/manifold/sandbox \
    /var/lib/manifold/containers \
    /var/lib/manifold/layers \
    /var/lib/manifold/runtime \
    /var/log/manifold \
    /run/manifold \
    && chown -R manifold:manifold /var/lib/manifold /var/log/manifold /run/manifold

# Copy binaries from builder
COPY --from=builder --chown=manifold:manifold \
    /build/target/release/manifolded-engine \
    /build/target/release/manifolded-conductor \
    /opt/manifold/bin/

# Copy security profiles and configurations
COPY --chown=manifold:manifold configs/security/ /opt/manifold/config/security/

# Layer 1: Linux Namespaces Configuration
RUN echo "user.max_user_namespaces=15000" >> /etc/sysctl.conf && \
    echo "kernel.unprivileged_userns_clone=1" >> /etc/sysctl.conf

# Layer 2: Seccomp Profiles
COPY --chown=manifold:manifold configs/seccomp/ /opt/manifold/config/seccomp/

# Layer 3: Capability Configuration
RUN setcap 'cap_sys_admin,cap_net_admin,cap_sys_chroot+eip' /opt/manifold/bin/manifolded-engine

# Layer 4: AppArmor Profiles
COPY configs/apparmor/manifold-profile /etc/apparmor.d/
RUN apparmor_parser -r /etc/apparmor.d/manifold-profile || true

# Layer 5: Cgroup Configuration
RUN echo "cgroup_enable=memory swapaccount=1" >> /etc/default/grub || true

# Layer 6: Network Isolation Setup
COPY configs/iptables/sandbox-rules.sh /opt/manifold/config/
RUN chmod +x /opt/manifold/config/sandbox-rules.sh

# Layer 7: Filesystem Isolation
RUN mkdir -p /opt/manifold/sandbox/readonly && \
    chmod 555 /opt/manifold/sandbox/readonly

# Layer 8: Kata Containers Configuration
COPY configs/kata/configuration.toml /etc/kata-containers/
ENV KATA_RUNTIME_PATH=/usr/bin/kata-runtime

# gRPC Service Configuration
EXPOSE 50051 50052 9090

# Health check endpoint
HEALTHCHECK --interval=30s --timeout=10s --start-period=60s --retries=3 \
    CMD ["/opt/manifold/bin/manifolded-engine", "health"]

# Environment variables for sandboxing
ENV MANIFOLD_SANDBOX_LAYERS=8 \
    MANIFOLD_SECURITY_LEVEL=maximum \
    MANIFOLD_ISOLATION=strict \
    MANIFOLD_RUNTIME=kata \
    RUST_LOG=info \
    RUST_BACKTRACE=1

# Volume for container storage (sandboxed)
VOLUME ["/var/lib/manifold/containers"]

# Run as non-root by default (escalate internally when needed)
USER manifold
WORKDIR /var/lib/manifold

# Start the conductor service
ENTRYPOINT ["/opt/manifold/bin/manifolded-conductor"]
CMD ["--config", "/opt/manifold/config/manifold.toml", "--production"]

content.text: Now let's create the Vimmacs integration Dockerfile:

input.content:
# Vimmacs WebAssembly Linux Distribution Integration
# Deploy to: registry.ovh.net/vimmacs/runtime:latest

# Stage 1: Build Vimmacs WASM Runtime
FROM rust:1.75-bookworm AS wasm-builder

WORKDIR /build

# Install WASM build dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    pkg-config \
    libssl-dev \
    cmake \
    protobuf-compiler \
    wabt \
    binaryen \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Copy Vimmacs backend components
COPY ../vimmacs/backend/wasmer-runtime /build/wasmer-runtime
COPY ../vimmacs/backend/neural-field-core /build/neural-field-core

# Build WASM runtime with Kata integration
WORKDIR /build/wasmer-runtime
RUN cargo build --release --features "kata metrics cranelift"

# Stage 2: Arch Linux WebAssembly Userspace
FROM archlinux:latest AS arch-wasm

# Install Arch Linux base system for WASM
RUN pacman -Syu --noconfirm && \
    pacman -S --noconfirm \
    base \
    base-devel \
    neovim \
    emacs \
    git \
    tmux \
    zsh \
    ripgrep \
    fd \
    bat \
    exa \
    && pacman -Scc --noconfirm

# Create WASM-compatible filesystem structure
RUN mkdir -p /wasm-root/bin \
    /wasm-root/lib \
    /wasm-root/usr \
    /wasm-root/etc \
    /wasm-root/home \
    /wasm-root/tmp \
    /wasm-root/var

# Copy essential Arch Linux files for WASM environment
RUN cp -r /usr/bin/* /wasm-root/bin/ || true && \
    cp -r /usr/lib/* /wasm-root/lib/ || true && \
    cp -r /etc/* /wasm-root/etc/ || true

# Stage 3: Final Integration Runtime
FROM debian:bookworm-slim

# Install runtime dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    ca-certificates \
    libssl3 \
    libc6 \
    libgcc-s1 \
    libstdc++6 \
    kata-runtime \
    curl \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Create runtime user
RUN groupadd -r vimmacs && \
    useradd -r -g vimmacs -u 1001 \
    --home-dir /var/lib/vimmacs \
    --shell /bin/bash vimmacs

# Set up directory structure
RUN mkdir -p \
    /opt/vimmacs/bin \
    /opt/vimmacs/wasm \
    /opt/vimmacs/arch-root \
    /opt/vimmacs/config \
    /var/lib/vimmacs/cache \
    /var/lib/vimmacs/sessions \
    /var/log/vimmacs \
    && chown -R vimmacs:vimmacs /var/lib/vimmacs /var/log/vimmacs

# Copy WASM runtime from builder
COPY --from=wasm-builder --chown=vimmacs:vimmacs \
    /build/wasmer-runtime/target/release/vimmacs-wasmer-runtime \
    /opt/vimmacs/bin/

# Copy Arch Linux WASM filesystem
COPY --from=arch-wasm --chown=vimmacs:vimmacs \
    /wasm-root \
    /opt/vimmacs/arch-root/

# Copy Vimmacs configurations
COPY --chown=vimmacs:vimmacs ../vimmacs/config/ /opt/vimmacs/config/

# WASM Module Cache
VOLUME ["/var/lib/vimmacs/cache"]

# Session Storage
VOLUME ["/var/lib/vimmacs/sessions"]

# WebAssembly Configuration
ENV WASMER_DIR=/opt/vimmacs \
    WASMER_CACHE_DIR=/var/lib/vimmacs/cache \
    WASM_ARCH_ROOT=/opt/vimmacs/arch-root \
    WASM_MAX_MEMORY=4294967296 \
    WASM_STACK_SIZE=8388608 \
    WASM_COMPILER=cranelift \
    KATA_INTEGRATION=enabled

# gRPC and HTTP endpoints
EXPOSE 50052 8081 9091

# Health check
HEALTHCHECK --interval=30s --timeout=10s --start-period=30s --retries=3 \
    CMD curl -f http://localhost:8081/health || exit 1

# Run as non-root
USER vimmacs
WORKDIR /var/lib/vimmacs

# Start WASM runtime service
ENTRYPOINT ["/opt/vimmacs/bin/vimmacs-wasmer-runtime"]
CMD ["--config", "/opt/vimmacs/config/runtime.toml", "--arch-root", "/opt/vimmacs/arch-root"]
